etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Henry Garnsey (1826–1903). From peri- + -plasm

definitions: In an oomycete, especially one of the order Peronosporales: the outer portion of the cytoplasm in an oogonium or antheridium.
The cytoplasm just inside the vitelline membrane of an insect's egg, surrounding the yolk.
The region of a bacterial or other cell between the plasma membrane and the cell wall or outer membrane.
